name: Janice Arnold
biography: Janice Arnold (b. 1953) is a self-taught felt maker. While working in visual merchandising for Nordstrom Corporate Visual Merchandising, she received the assignment of producing a large number of felt sculptures for window displays. She traveled to Central Asia to try to source the material there, learned the felt-making process from the local women, and has been working exclusively in felt ever since. She does primarily large-scale installations and theatrical work, and some her clients include Cirque du Soleil, Celebrity Cruise/ Royal Caribbean Cruise Line, Disney Corporation, LA Opera, Universal Pictures, Wieden + Kennedy, and The Rockefeller Group.
